data.text: He that feareth the Lord will do good;
And as a mother shall she meet him,
With the bread of understanding shall she feed him,
He shall be stayed upon her, and shall not be moved;
She shall exalt him above his neighbors,
He shall find joy and a crown of gladness,
But foolish men shall not attain unto her,
For she is far from pride,
Praise is not seemly in the mouth of a sinner,
For praise shall be uttered in wisdom,
Say not thou, It is through the Lord that I fell away:
Say not thou, He hath caused me to err:
The Lord hateth all abomination;
He himself made man from the beginning,
If thou wilt, to keep the commandments,
He hath set fire and water before thee:
Before man is life and death;
For the wisdom of the Lord is great,
And his eyes are upon them that fear him,
He hath commanded no man to do wickedly,
